title: Report Players In Champ Select
body:
As the title states, we need the ability to report people before the game even begins, or at least start logging the Champion Select chat so when we do report a player the tribunal can review the Champion Selection chat log.

I have had two recent instances of games where at the last minute a troll steals another players role then "acts nicely and innocent" in game while everyone else is complaining in game so he would not get banned.

These trolls are obviously manipulating the system, so it needs to be corrected. These are the really toxic players that need to be punished but are falling through the cracks.

replies.body: Also be able to mute players in champion select. I wish I could just "omg this dumbass is going karthus jg gg" - "well this is a normal game and yes karthus can jungle" - "go fucking kill yourself" (muted).
{{champion:30}} I would, but I can't die...

Problem with this is only that people who choose to do something non-meta like karthus jungle or ADC janna will get reported even if they were to do well. In my opinion, you should only be able to mute them in champ select for the time being.

I agree. It's stupid to be able to report people in champ select with the community in the state that it is. The truly innocent players would be the ones to suffer the most, not the players that are actually causing harm to the community.

And what about the lane stolers and the flamers that makes you just close the launcher before the game start to not be with them? Am so agreeing with report at champ select they are doushes that makes you take an 5 to idk how much time ban before you can play again, and they are just continuing to play.

Yes i know there will be trollers that will report you for nothing at the start of the game but im saying dont make the reports at the start of the game a full reports, make them count as half report for the tribunal.

You mean the ones you could just suck up and play with anyways because YOU could still pull a win out of a game by just sucking up your sour mood and playing the game?

I have had plenty of those in ranked, but I ALWAYS suck it up and play. I don't always win, but at least i go and put in the effort to play the game instead of giving up before it even starts. Why lose LP without even trying because of some other player? You could still end up winning as I and many other players who stuck with it have.

I know that in the long run, it doesn't help things, like late game when you need to hear them, but if these players bother you so much, use the dang mute button. If you don't have the will to try from the very beginning, that's your problem and in the end those "lane-stealers" and "flamers" get exactly what they want no matter if you dodge or not.

Reports in the beginning would only be hurting people that are picking off the meta picks, not these "lane-stealers" your referring to. You think reports in the beginning would help. It wouldn't. Here's an example:

First pick: heading mid
Second pick: I'm reporting you. I called mid in chat
First pick: But I'm first pick.
Second pick: I'm reporting you for first-picking (insert champion) because you'll easily get countered and it's helping the enemy team by first picking that champion.
First pick: Then I'll report you for negative attitude
Second pick: Go ahead. I've done nothing wrong. Enjoy the ban :).
Third pick: guys. Calm down. Let it go.
Fourth pick: This game is gonna be SO MUCH FUN.

Morale is down from the beginning and the team won't work together. After all, First and Second pick people have already reported each other and will refuse to work together. Result: YOU HAVE BEEN DEFEATED. Grudges are only human. Did the report help this team? No.

As for the half reports your suggesting, they would be deemed invalid and would mostly be disregarded because there would be MANY more reports sent to the Tribunal, which would result in the Tribunal being down more to sort through these, resulting in a less efficient Justice system for League. The only reports that would matter are the ones at the end, which not only don't create grudges early, but also provide 30-60 minutes of evidence against them as opposed to the 5 minutes for the "mini reports" in which not much will be proven, esp since the ones in lobby could lie about what pick they were and the Tribunal would be none the wiser (in case you never went on Tribunal, they are not informed of summoner names or what position in the queue they were. They are only aware of the Champions within the game and what they had for items and spells)

Yeah if only the people who were put at a disadvantage by someone else on their team would just pick up all the slack themselves and win the game for everyone. Trolls should be able to ruin people's games AND you think they should expect to win if people just "suck up their sour mood." 

Your logic... holy fuck. Let's not.

I'm not saying expect to win. I'm saying stick through it. You are gonna dodge and lose lp by not playing the game at all without trying? And what if this supposed troll actually does well? There are a lot of issues that people have in ranked and everyone has had their number of trolls, but it's the people to stick to it that often get surprised at the result of the match. If you dodge, you lose lp without even putting any effort into the game. When i say suck it up, I mean tough it out. Stick through it. Ranked are hardly enjoyable anymore thanks to the community and when i go into one, i don't expect to have fun. By dodging, you give exactly what they want and it only hurts you. It takes a strong person to tough it out in game and work as a team to pull out a win even if the odds are against you. If you can't do it in a game, how are you going to handle real life? And how exactly do you get anywhere in ranked with this ideal that you lose before you even get into the game. I know it isn't right if someone steals a role, but sometimes you have to work with what you got. If you don't like what they are doing, report them at end. Just don't dodge the queue and then blame the troll for why you lost the lp. I didn't get to gold last season by dodging queues. I got it by working hard and sticking through every game i played. I never dodged a ranked and I never will. It's not in my character to give up before I try and I expect of others what I expect of myself.

Sure you did.

It's not possible that other people have different experiences with the game than you.

So what you're suggesting is to let these people go unpunished? So everyone in league should just start insta-locking to the role of their choice because there is no punishment. I mean if we all forced mid we may pull out a win right?

That's the problem. These people should be banned. Nobody should have to put up with people who locks a mid champ when they are last pick and we really needed a support. So that person goes mid in game, acts all nice and innocent so when Riot reviews log they of course won't get banned, while everyone else might due to them swearing at the person. So who gets stuck being the support? Oh the Zed that first picked for mid. He's forced to play as the support because of this troll.

Zed support? Game is winnable if the other team is just terrible, which at that point you seriously have to question why you're even facing them.

I am suggesting that the Tribunal, or whatever Riot uses to review reports, to start literally recording footage of the champion select screen. The entire thing. That way if there is false reports for off-meta picks then those false reporters get "temp banned" themselves. Just as you would if you made a false police report. They will get to see who picked the champion first, read the logs to see if any player indicated what, etc.

Will this ban players who first state "x role" but another player chooses the champion for it before them? Nope. This will not ban those players because that is fair game.

I'm not saying they don't get punished. I agree that champ select chat should be included within the report at the end. What I'm saying is that implementing a report system before game will render most reports invalid and less likely to make it to tribunal at all. In the end, players are the ones that decide the fate of those reported, not Riot. The system can very well be abused. A report for before the game is impractical and more than likely will provide no help in getting rid of toxic players, esp since toxicity will be created THROUGH these reports.
That is stupid

No excuse.

Karthus jungle is well known.

Agreed. I get so tired of people trolling lobbies locking the same role as someone before them and fucking with everyone elses game.

Especially when it's a troll duo+. Had a game where I first picked my ADC, fourth pick raged and locked Varus in anyways and went top with Kassadin, leaving my support to cover mid. Played for about 5 minutes and decided fuck this, and alt f4'd. What a waste of time.
I want to report the trolls when they already said they are going to feed.

I think it woud be great if there are several things Riot can offer.

For example, we are able to "block" players so that they cannot add you as a friend. What if we make this "Block" more complete? There are so many players that I will never ever want to play with again. 
So if we can block them from join a team from the queue system, this would definitely better.

Furthermore, we do have that honorable mark which we can see before the game starts. What if we can see how many times that a player is reported. What if we put this into the queuing system that you will have teammates that would have the same report time level with you?

the only thing I can think about that last half, is somebody being flamed for how many times they've been reported.  
Let's be optimistic here (I know, gross) and assume somebody was reported 50 times, (idk. random number) then was banned for awhile. 
Comes back from his ban with the intent to change his attitude, but gets into a game where people are mad that he [appears] to be a bad team mate.
Okay so it seems like there should be an another system which you can earn your reliability back XD.

No, they need to implement a system where your team can vote to dodge for no LP loss or game loss in series during champ select.  In the last game of my last series, I had this troll who was last pick and demanded mid.  I was afk getting a drink when he said he wanted mid in our chat.  When I picked Diana with our second pick, he started typing in all caps at me about how he was going to come mid with me or feed the enemy team.  He could have said something to me earlier because I hovered Ziggs, Ahri, and LB for the entire time leading up to my pick before locking in Diana last second.  To try and stop his trolling, I offered to take Diana top, but he didn't want that.  He only wanted to come with me to lane and feed the enemy.  After a minute or so, he, seemingly, calmed down, and said he wouldn't troll if I told him where to go.  The fourth pick on our team was hovering Maokai, and I told the guy to go adc.  Well Maokai changed his mind and locked in Draven last second.  I try and tell this guy to go top, but he doesn't respond to me for a second.  Then he tells me, "no, you said adc.  I'm going adc."  When it came to our last pick, this troll instalocks Jinx.  Then says it's my fault since I told him he had to adc.
Agreed.  I've heard some of the meanest rudest things in pregame/postgame lobby
Tribunal doesn't exist anymore.

I have always wished in champ select that there was a way to vote kick somebody.  Kinda like in WoW. Where your team can vote to kick somebody.  It would essentially start the lobby over - but wouldn't count as a leave for the rest of the team.
